meanings.definition: The act of cutting out or removing something.
meanings.sent1: The excision of the tumor was successful.
meanings.sent2: The doctor performed an excision to remove the foreign object.
meanings.sent3: After the excision of the splinter, the patient felt relieved.
meanings.sent4: Her excision of toxic people from her life brought her peace.
meanings.sent5: The excision of the old tree from the yard left a noticeable gap.

meanings.definition: The surgical removal of tissue or part of an organ.
meanings.sent1: The excision of the appendix was necessary to prevent further complications.
meanings.sent2: The excision of the tumor required a skilled surgeon.
meanings.sent3: The excision of the cake from the plate was done with precision.
meanings.sent4: His excision of doubt from his mind cleared the way for confidence.
meanings.sent5: The excision of the damaged part of the building saved the rest from collapse.

meanings.definition: The removal of a segment of DNA.
meanings.sent1: The excision of the faulty gene was a breakthrough in genetic research.
meanings.sent2: The excision of the DNA segment altered the genetic makeup of the organism.
meanings.sent3: The excision of the wrong DNA segment led to unexpected results.
meanings.sent4: Her excision of the harmful DNA sequence was like cutting out a cancer.
meanings.sent5: The excision of the gene mutation restored normal function to the cell.
